title: Mass. homebuyers can no longer waive inspections. Here’s what to know.

title: Healey: Mass. has ‘zero tolerance’ for street takeovers
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey announced a $14 million safety grant in response to recent street takeovers across the state.
State Police, collaborating with local departments, issued over 200 citations and made seven arrests to curb illegal car meetups.
Healey stresses zero tolerance for street takeovers, urging public reporting of such events to enhance community safety.

title: Even a season-ending injury won’t stop Deatrich Wise from giving back to Mattapan
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The former Patriot will continue with his annual block party in Mattapan this weekend.
Deatrich Wise spent the first eight seasons of his career playing for the Patriots.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) After spending the first eight years of his career with the Patriots, Deatrich Wise left for the first time this offseason to join the Washington Commanders.

title: These Boston job openings come with six-figure salaries — here’s who’s hiring
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News With the Mass.
Transparency Law going into effect at the end of the month, here's a list of the highest paid positions open in Boston.
We looked at LinkedIn to find the highest-paying full-time job openings across industries.

title: 5 men facing assault, but not hate crime, charges in alleged attack on gay couple in Mattapan
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime An initial police report described the incident as a suspected hate crime, but authorities said they are not pursuing civil rights charges at this time.

By Abby Patkin October 16, 2025 | 2:59 PM 1 minute to read Five men are facing assault and battery charges in connection with an alleged violent attack on a gay couple in Mattapan last month, though Boston police said authorities aren’t seeking civil rights charges.
The same-sex couple told police they were walking down River Street shortly before 8 p.

title: After ‘short-lived’ Celtics stint, Jrue Holiday says he’s happy in Portland
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics “Everyone was assuming I was miserable or unhappy with it, but when I got the call from [Celtics president] Brad [Stevens], I was super excited.
" Jrue Holiday in preseason game for his new Portland Trail Blazers (Craig Mitchelldyer/AP).
Jrue Holiday is settling into his new home on the west coast, as he was traded this offseason to the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Haverhill mayor names outside investigator to examine police leadership
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The investigation will be limited in scope, and not include a review of a July incident where a man died while being detained by police.
A cruiser from the Haverhill Police Department.
Haverhill Police Department An outside investigation into the Haverhill Police Department is set to begin this week, with an attorney appointed by Mayor Melinda Barrett overseeing the review.

title: Uniqlo to open in long-vacant Downtown Crossing building
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The retailer will move into a high-profile property that has sat empty since 2006, as new owners look to bring more life back into the recovering shopping district.
The exterior of 399 Washington St.
in Downton Crossing.
